SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.plus.util

Class TextUtil

java.lang.Object
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.plus.util.TextUtil
public class TextUtil extends Object
This is a utility class for transforming beans and other classes into consistent and well aligned text. Can be used to easily generate readable log or CSV files.
Author:
nikolay.grozev

  • Method Details

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(List<String> headers, List<? extends Class<?>> headerClasses, String delim)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text. Convenient for generating a header line in a log or a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      headers - - the names of the headers.
      headerClasses - - the types of the headers. May be null or empty if the types are unknown.
      delim - - the delimter.
      Returns:
      a line for the headers.

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(List<?> objects, List<String> headers, String delimeter, boolean includeFieldNames)
      Converts the specified list of objects to a single line of text. Convenient to converting to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. The line is formatted in a way so that if put under a line with the headers it will be aligned. If the headers list is empty or null it is ignored.
      The flag includeFieldNames is used to specify if the names of the properties should be included in the result. If it is true, the result will consist of entries like: "propA=valueA"
      Parameters:
      objects - - the list of objects to print in the line.
      headers - - the headers. Must be of the same size as objects or null or empty.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to use.
      includeFieldNames - - a flag whether to include the names of the properties in the line as well.
      Returns:

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(Object obj)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text. Convenient to converting an object to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. For the purpose all get methods of the object are consequently called and the results are appended with appropriate formatting. Users, can control which get methods are being called by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(Object obj, String delimeter)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text. Convenient to converting an object to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. For the purpose all get methods of the object are consequently called and the results are appended with appropriate formatting. Users, can control which get methods are being called by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      The flag includeFieldNames is used to specify if the names of the properties should be included in the result. If it is true, the result will consist of entries like: "propA=valueA"
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(Object obj, String[] properties)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text. Convenient to converting an object to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. For the purpose all get methods of the object are consequently called and the results are appended with appropriate formatting. Users, can control which get methods are called by directly specifying the properties of interest (with the "properties" parameter).
      The flag includeFieldNames is used to specify if the names of the properties should be included in the result. If it is true, the result will consist of entries like: "propA=valueA"
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(Object obj, String delimeter, String[] properties)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text. Convenient to converting an object to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. For the purpose all get methods of the object are consequently called and the results are appended with appropriate formatting. Users, can control which get methods are called either by directly specifying the properties of interest (with the "properties" parameter) or by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      The flag includeFieldNames is used to specify if the names of the properties should be included in the result. If it is true, the result will consist of entries like: "propA=valueA"
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getTxtLine

      public static String getTxtLine(Object obj, String delimeter, String[] properties, boolean includeFieldNames)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text. Convenient to converting an object to a line in a log or a line in a CSV file. For the purpose all get methods of the object are consequently called and the results are appended with appropriate formatting. Users, can control which get methods are called either by directly specifying the properties of interest (with the "properties" parameter) or by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      The flag includeFieldNames is used to specify if the names of the properties should be included in the result. If it is true, the result will consist of entries like: "propA=valueA"
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      includeFieldNames - - a flag whether to include the names of the properties in the line as well.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getTxtLine

      public static <F> String getTxtLine(F obj, String delimeter, String[] properties, boolean includeFieldNames, LinkedHashMap<String,com.google.common.base.Function<? extends F,String>> virtualProps)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text by concatenating its properties and "Virtual Properties". Essentially this methods calls invalid input: '{@link TextUtil.getTxtLine(final Object obj, final String delimeter, final String[] properties, final boolean includeFieldNames)'} to textualise the properties and then appends the virtual properties.

      Each virtual property is specified by a name and a function. The function takes as a parameter the object and returns a string.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      includeFieldNames - - a flag whether to include the names of the properties in the line as well.
      virtualProps - - must not be null. The Functions must not throw exceptions or modify the state of the object
      Returns:

    • getTxtLine

      public static <F> String getTxtLine(F obj, String[] properties, LinkedHashMap<String,com.google.common.base.Function<? extends F,String>> virtualProps)
      Converts the specified object to a single line of text by concatenating its properties and "Virtual Properties". Essentially this methods calls invalid input: '{@link TextUtil.getTxtLine(final Object obj, final String delimeter, final String[] properties, final boolean includeFieldNames)'} to textualise the properties and then appends the virtual properties.

      Each virtual property is specified by a name and a function. The function takes as a parameter the object and returns a string.
      Parameters:
      obj - - the object to extract text from. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      virtualProps - - must not be null. The Functions must not throw exceptions or modify the state of the object
      Returns:

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text. Convenient for generating a header line in a log or a CSV file. For the purpose the names of all properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") are concatenated with appropriate padding and formatting. Users, can control which properties are used by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties and the order they need.
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz, String delimeter)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text. Convenient for generating a header line in a log or a CSV file. For the purpose the names of all properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" orString.valueOf(obj) "is") are concatenated with appropriate padding. The specified delimeter is placed between the entries in the line. Users, can control which properties are used by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties and the order they need.
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz, String[] properties)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text. Convenient for generating a header line in a log or a CSV file. For the purpose the names of all properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" orString.valueOf(obj) "is") are concatenated with appropriate padding. The specified delimeter is placed between the entries in the line. Users, can control properties are used either by directly specifying the properties of interest (with the "properties" parameter) or by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz, String delimeter, String[] properties)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text. Convenient for generating a header line in a log or a CSV file. For the purpose the names of all properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" orString.valueOf(obj) "is") are concatenated with appropriate padding. The specified delimeter is placed between the entries in the line. Users, can control properties are used either by directly specifying the properties of interest (with the "properties" parameter) or by using the Textualize annotation and specifying the properties (the parts of the get methods after "get" or "is") and the order they need.
      Note that if the class is annotated with Textualize the order specified in the annotation is used. If not - the order of the methods is defined by the class they appear in (this classe's props first, then its superclass and so on). Properties defined within the same class are sorted alphabetically.
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      Returns:
      formated line of text, as described above.

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz, String delimeter, String[] properties, String[] virtualProps)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text by appending its properties and a set of so-called "virtual properties".
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      delimeter - - the delimeter to put between the entries in the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      virtualProps - - virtual properties, which are not actual properties of the class.
      Returns:

    • getCaptionLine

      public static String getCaptionLine(Class<?> clazz, String[] properties, String[] virtualProps)
      Converts the specified class to a single line of text by appending its properties and a set of so-called "virtual properties".
      Parameters:
      clazz - - the class to use to create the line. Must not be null.
      properties - - the properties to include in the line. If null all properties specified in a Textualize annotation are used. If null and no Textualize is defined for the class - then all properties are used.
      virtualProps - - virtual properties, which are not actual properties of the class.
      Returns:

      virtualProps - - virtual properties, which are not actual properties of the class.
